comments.text:
There just isn't enough undeniable evidence to support any claim of murder. 
People have some interesting evidence but most of it is simple biased views 
and the fact they can not accept the idea of suicide so they create this 
murder idea. The myth of Cobain sounds much better to fans if he didn't 
kill himself so they cling to the idea at the expense of his loved ones.

It's mostly just assholes who want to make money from a tragic event that 
push these ideas. That El whatshisface was just some drunk idiot who has 
been known to lie constantly and some fans take his words as absolute 
gospel. The Heroin idea at least has science behind it however the science 
used is not a complete test because it fails to take into account tolerance 
built up by addicts. Over time you need to use more and more to get a high 
and it doesn't have the same effect on you that it did. Kurt regularly 
pushed the boat out on how much he would take so it's not that hard to 
imagine with his tolerance levels he was capable of using a shotgun with a 
lot of Heroin in his system.

The money motive on Courtney too it's just not really enough of a motive to 
want to kill somebody and pay off enough people to get away with it. She 
was already becoming famous before she met Kurt and would have made money 
regardless of marrying him so this idea that she killed him to avoid losing 
everything in a divorce is silly. Arguably having a divorce would have just 
made her more famous as she would have been regardless of marrying Kurt.

+Jay K Wrong. A triple lethal overdose will kill you on the spot or cause 
you to immediately slip into a coma and die a bit later. Either way you'll 
be incapacitated before you can even get the needle out of your arm, leave 
alone taking the tourniquet off, roll down the sleeve, button it up, put 
all your drug paraphernalia neatly into a cigar box and THEN take the 
shotgun and shoot yourself in the head. Also, why bring the shotgun in the 
first place when you know perfectly well that the amount of junk you're 
about to shoot yourself up with will kill you right off the bat anyway? On 
top of that, the "suicide" letter was written in 2 different handwritings 
and it's only the last 4 lines that "make" it a suicide letter and they 
weren't written by Kurt. And finally, how come there were no fingerprints 
on the gun or the shells although they belonged to Kurt and he supposedly 
shot himself with it? There weren't even partial prints, that means someone 
must have wiped it off. If you put everything together it's pretty obvious 
that someone else must have been there, and it's also pretty clear that 
Kurt couldn't have shot himself. Don't take my word for it, though, in 
regards to how long it takes someone to die from a triple lethal overdose. 
Go to a hospital and ask a doctor. The autopsy report stated that Kurt must 
have injected himself between 225 to 245 milligrams of heroin per liter 
blood.

top_comment.text:
THE TEN COMMANDMENTS (Exodus 20:1-17)
1.     You shall have no other gods before me.
Has God always been first in your life?
 
2.     You shall not make for yourself an idol.
Have you made a god with your hands or your mind to suit yourself?
 
3.     You shall not take the name of the LORD your God in vain.
Have you used God’s name lightly or to show disgust?
 
4.     Remember the Sabbath Day to keep it holy.
The days He gives to us are a gift, yet we fail to give thanks for them.
 
5.     Honor your father and mother.
Have you always done what is pleasing for your parents?
 
6.     You shall not kill.
Jesus said that if you hate your brother without cause you will be in 
danger of the judgment; have you ever been unjustly angry with someone?
(Matthew 5:21,22) Whoever hates his brother is a murderer… (1 John 3:15)
 
7.     You shall not commit adultery.
Jesus said that if you look at someone to lust after them that you have 
committed adultery already in your heart; have you ever looked with lust?
(Matthew 5:27,28)
 
8.     You shall not steal.
Have you ever stolen anything, value is irrelevant?
 
9.     You shall not lie.
How many lies have you told in your life?
 
10.   You shall not covet.
Have you ever desired something that did not belong to you?
 
1 John 3:4
…for sin is transgression of the Law.
James 2:10
For whosoever shall keep the whole Law, and yet offend in one point, he is 
guilty of all.
Ecclesiastes 12:14
For God will bring every work into judgment, including every secret thing, 
whether good or evil.
 
There is a day coming in which God will judge you according to His 
righteousness. The Bible says that God is a just judge, and he will judge 
your every thought, word, and deed. How many times have you violated His 
Law? The punishment for these crimes is a prison called Hell, and it is a 
life sentence (eternity).
If you’re honest with yourself, you know that you have broken God’s Law a 
multitude of times. You will have to answer to God for every sin you ever 
committed against Him. God is so good that He must punish all people who 
willingly violate His moral Law. No one will escape from justice in God’s 
courtroom.
                There is only one way to avoid this prison from which there 
will be no escape, if a sinless person takes your punishment then God can 
let you go free.  Jesus of Nazareth, the Son of God, suffered capital 
punishment (death) on a cross. Jesus paid the fine you owe in His life’s 
blood. John 3:16,17 says, “For God so loved the world that He gave His only 
begotten Son, that whoever believes in Him should not perish but have 
everlasting life. For God did not send His Son into the world to condemn 
world, but that the world through Him might be saved.”
                The gift of God is eternal life in Christ Jesus. The only 
way to receive His gift is to repent (turn from your sins) and put your 
trust in Jesus!  Please do so today. We are not promised to live tomorrow. 
Our lives may be taken at any moment, and we will then stand before God in 
judgment. “Is sin so luscious that you will burn in Hell forever for it?” – 
Charles Spurgeon﻿

comments.text:
+Joshua West
Generally you don't make tea with it either but you can. I'm not saying 
that you should go rub yourself with buds. It is physically possible to 
absorb THC through the skin but it has to be in the right medium. Like the 
links I posted, in budder it can occur but you'd have to be running your 
hands through a large quantity. The point I was trying to get across is 
that Jimi didn't have to cut himself to absorb LSD through his forehead. He 
would just have to put enough blotters under the headband. It wouldn't take 
that much.
comments.author: hueseph

comments.text:
LSD is water soluble, though generally prepared in an ethanol solution. 
Also absorption through the skin does readily occur, that's how it's uh... 
"properties" were discovered by Albert Hofmann. Although he probably had a 
very potent dose when he accidentally got the purified sample on his finger 
tips. So in general hueseph was correct in assuming that the cuts would be 
unnecessary. In regards to THC, don't forget about lipid solubility. Though 
I have never heard of anyone getting a high from THC oil rubbed on their 
skin, it may be possible with a potent dose, yet not practical as its 
readily absorbed via adipose tissue and may never see the brain. The same 
reason it stays in your system so long without you being "high" 24/7.

perceptions of the majority consensus. My own analogy

Two men are alone together in a room. One is wearing a red shirt, and the 
other is wearing a blue shirt. One of the two is color blind to the others 
particular color and says the that other is his color and so forth. Which 
man is correct? Well...as it stands...both are correct as far as they can 
tell. Only by and outside source can the debate be resolved. If it's more 
color blinded people, the that man is correct. If it's "normal" people than 
the other. Perception is funny that way, and that's the real reason I 
believe people are so lenient with scientific facts and or studies. It's 
been inconclusive with each passing generation. 500 years from now we'll 
all be looked at as primitive, and 1000 after that and so on. These debates 
have been and will always be a waste of time.

comments.text:
+xxes11xx Your a bit confused xD He never had SURGERY to correct his 
Vitiligo. At first he covered it up to match his skin tone through the 
thriller years and by Bad it had covered so much of his body that he was 
literally going onstage with almost full-body makeup. He tried loads of 
treatments to get the skin pigmentation back, but none were successful. So, 
in order to even out his skin and avoid the "patchy" look, he ended up 
having most of the pigment removed from his skin to match the vitiligo 
patches. Thats why the end result he looked very pale, as he had 
practically no pigmentation. The nose surgery is a completely different 
thing. He originally got minor changes to his nose for completely cosmetic 
reasons, as many celebrities do. Unfortunately this is before he was 
diagnosed with the autoimmune disease Lupus, which inhibited his ability to 
heal. Which meant the surgery didn't heal up properly and he kept having to 
go under the knife to fix the previous surgery. It progressively got worse 
and worse and there was less and less the plastic surgeons could do. His 
nose at one point actually started collapsing. ON TOP of all this, the 
constant corrective surgeries started to restrict his breathing which in 
turn affected his singing. And thus even more surgeries. It kinda just 
snowballed. Then after the Pepsi burn, he was put on loads of pain 
medications which he eventually became addicted to. Part of that addiction 
is the illusion that you are still in pain even though there is nothing 
physically wrong. This led to his drug battle, he lost loads of weight AND 
around the same time became a vegetarian (more weight loss)  which is why 
he looked so thin and unhealthy in his later years.  Plus he started having 
loads of mental problems like depression after the child molestation cases 
and all the media attention that followed. Basically, he was dealt a really 
bad hand in life. A real shame for someone so talented :/
comments.author: ABlueCatsRegret

comments.text:
Consider that none of Kurt's close friends thought that he was murdered, 
let alone murdered by Courtney. Also consider that Courtney was Kurt's life 
support for years, keeping him alive during his oblivion overdoses. Just 
before his death, Kurt dropped Francis while high; Courtney, Kurt's family, 
Dave Grohl, Krist, David Geffen, and others got together and had an 
intervention with Kurt - went to rehab immediately after, but shut everyone 
in his life out. He escaped and showed up at his home where Francis was 
located, apologized to her, and then was found dead after, the police 
investigation concluded it was an obvious suicide.

Personally, despite Courtney Love being the target, I think this whole 
witch hunt is incredibly insensitive. How would you like it if someone you 
loved died, and then some asshole documentary filmmaker fabricated a murder 
theory story implicating you? Nick Broomfield is famous for his 
exploitative murder conspiracy theories. I am actually surprised that one 
of his other ones, Suge Knight killing Tupac and Biggie, was not on the 
list.

comments.text:
+troodon9999 Myth is never used to describe something verified as true. And 
yes I am aware of the presumption of innocence, but it doesn't keep me from 
knowing O.J. was guilty. As far as evidence of suicide goes I'm not really 
that familiar with Cobain's case because he didn't really matter much to 
me. but my understanding is that drug overdose was the cause of death? OD's 
rarely provide much evidence of suicide unless there's a verifiable note or 
the deceased was alone at the time. And people love to speculate about 
celebrity deaths. And did you mean to agree with me on the LSD? At any rate 
we are both correct, no cutting would be needed. As to Jimmy's soul, I'm 
sure it's intact. that was just humor.
comments.author: Frank Sanders

comments.text:
"Myth" in this sense I guess means stories commonly believed and often 
repeated, whether or not they're actually confirmed true or verifiable 
(keep in mind a myth is not necessarily false, although "myth" is rarely 
used to describe something verified as true).  Yes, technically speaking, 
"lack of enough evidence" doesn't necessarily mean one is innocent, but in 
the US legal system, one is presumed innocent until proven guilty, and 
there's plenty of evidence that Cobain's death was in fact a suicide.  It 
wouldn't have been the first time that someone addicted to drugs and 
severely depressed chose to commit suicide; I'm not sure why people find 
that so hard to believe and want to blame someone else.  BTW LSD can 
permeate the skin just fine without needing to be cut.  No comment on the 
whole "selling your soul" thing.  If the Devil indeed exists I'd doubt he'd 
bother buying up souls at such a high price.
comments.author: troodon9999

top_comment.text:
Speaking of making deals with the devil, I was at a garage sale one time 
wearing an AC/DC Highway to Hell tour t-shirt. A guy came up to me and 
started to talk to me about Angus Young. He told me how Angus sold his soul 
to the devil and how it was tragic that he died in 1991 while on tour and 
he hoped that I found God.

Now, I was about 16-17 years old at the time and didn't know much about 
AC/DC (I usually just listen to a band's music and not really look into 
facts about the members), so I looked up some info on Angus Young and found 
out that he was still alive and that he's actually Catholic.

I don't know. I just thought it would be a pretty funny story to share :)﻿

+Thomas Cleveland I got this from wiki: "Malcolm and Angus Young developed 
the idea for the band's name after their sister, Margaret Young, saw the 
initials "AC/DC" on a sewing machine. "AC/DC" is an abbreviation meaning 
"alternating current/direct current" electricity. The brothers felt that 
this name symbolised the band's raw energy, power-driven performances of 
their music. "AC/DC" is pronounced one letter at a time, though the band 
are colloquially known as "Acca Dacca" in Australia."

at 15 years old and people would constantly tell me that KISS stood for 
"Knights In Satan's Service." I did research after hearing that and found

And you're wrong about the death part. There's this thing in medicine 
called Incubation Period. Put shortly, it can last several months (Or a 
week or even years, it all depends on severity, location, etc) and during 
this time the rabies is travelling to the central nervous system. If you 
get yourself checked out and tested you WILL be cured most defiantly. And 
considering to get rabies you need to be bite by a bat or other wild, warm 
blooded animal rabies check is *routine* at any hospital or clinic.
However, if you have allowed rabies to travel within you for months (Due to 
not getting checked out) then the symptoms will start to show at the end of 
said period and it's near impossible for you to survive at that point as 
you'll die *within a few days.*

I think it's a pretty bad list as most of these weren't so much myths as 
lazy fact-checking or delusions held by people contrary to easily 
verifiable known facts.  The very first one on the list never should have 
been believed by anyone if they bothered to note that Marilyn Manson was 
already performing when Wonder Years was on the air.  I never got the 
"Elvis is still alive" thing; his death was neither unexpected or 
mysterious, it's not like he disappeared in the Bermuda Triangle or 
anything, he died of a heart attack when he was overweight, abusing drugs, 
and in poor health.  The Paul is dead thing was so ridiculous the Beatles 
intentionally made fun of it (a lot of the supposed evidence was because 
the Beatles were so amused by the rumor they intentionally placed false 
evidence of it all over the place).  But maybe Paul McCartney faked his 
death and went on to become Marilyn Manson?

everyone except whomever was convicted or arrested.

there are times that the official story isn't what really happened.

captions.text: [Narrator]: These stories are the stuff of legend.
[Announcer]: Ladies and gentlemen, Elvis has left the building.
[Narrator]: Welcome to WatchMojo.com, and today we’re counting down our picks for the top ten most shocking myths in rock music.
[Kevin]: That was my best friend, Paul Pfeiffer. Paul was allergic to everything.
[Narrator]: It’s not as wild as the myth that says Marilyn Manson had ribs removed to facilitate oral sex on himself.
But picturing a young Brian Warner on “The Wonder Years” is just as nutty.
[Kevin]: What? Are you crazy?
[Narrator]: Despite the stark contrast between the wholesome Paul Pfeiffer and the Antichrist Superstar’s image, it’s hard to deny the physical resemblances.
But, it’s actually Josh Saviano who played Kevin Arnold’s best friend, so put this rumor to rest.
[Paul]: Okay, maybe it's a dumb idea.
[Narrator]: Sometimes die-hard fans have trouble letting go – especially Elvis fans.
[Wadsworth]: On August 23rd in 1991 I saw Elvis Presley at Winesburg Inn in Clyde, Ohio.
[Narrator]: Inconsistencies on his death certificate caused some to suggest The King faked his death,
and tabloids are full of people who claim to have seen him in the flesh.
Fake death theories are also attached to Jim Morrison, since his body was never autopsied,
and Tupac, who keeps releasing new music that fans believe references future events.
Jimi was almost as famous for his drug use as he was for his guitar skills, so it’s not crazy to think he’d found a way to combine them.
Rumor has it the guitar great hid LSD under his bandanas while performing
and absorbed the acid through self-inflicted cuts in his forehead.
But that’s not all: the shady circumstances surrounding his death encouraged a persistent rumor that Hendrix was murdered.
Robert Johnson’s complex style made him a legend.
What’s also legendary is how the King of Mississippi Delta Blues allegedly got his skills:
by selling his soul to the Devil.
[Milhouse]: Why do you not sell your soul to me?
[Bart]: How much you got?
[Milhouse]: Five bucks.
[Bart]: Deal.
[Narrator]: Some point to his short life and songs like “Me and the Devil” as proof, but others know it was natural talent and hard work.
Another musician who allegedly made a deal with the Devil?
Led Zeppelin’s Jimmy Page.
While this legend’s been attributed to Elton John, Alanis Morissette, Lil’ Kim and more,
it’s most famously connected to Rod Stewart.
The story goes that the Brit was *ahem* servicing a fleet of sailors
when he had to go to the hospital to get his stomach pumped of all the excess fluid.
Though the singer-songwriter maintains a fired assistant concocted this bogus tale, he’s still asked about it.
Amid KISS’s loud anthemic music, eye-catching costumes and onstage antics, Gene Simmons made tongue-wagging his signature move.
His appendage quickly caught the attention of fans (and groupies) for its unusual length.
And soon, stories spread that The Demon had a cow’s tongue attached to his own.
But don’t worry: it wasn’t true and it wasn’t possible.
Simmons’ tongue looked nothing like a cow’s and medicine wasn’t that advanced then anyway.
Years of substance abuse led Keith Richards to want a clean slate.
The solution? A blood purification procedure.
But his status as a member of The World’s Greatest Rock & Roll Band meant the media hounded him about it.
So he fabricated an outrageous tale claiming doctors changed his blood with a new supply.
Another Richards anecdote: The Stones’ guitarist also said he snorted his father’s ashes.
[Interviewer]: You did in fact do it?
[Richards]: I ingested my ancestor, yes.
[Narrator]: The Beatles were the subject of many rumors, including one where they smoked up at Buckingham Palace.
After an American university paper said the Cute One died in a car crash and was replaced by a lookalike,
the story picked up steam with help from radio stations and “clues” in the Fab Four’s lyrics and album art.
[McCartney]: So this started some rumor that because he was barefooted he's dead. *audience laughs* I couldn't see the connection!
[Narrator]: While he was in an accident, Macca’s alive and going strong today.
When a shotgun and note were found near Kurt Cobain’s lifeless body, most accepted the Nirvana frontman’s death as suicide.
But conspiracy theorists cried murder.
Journalists and filmmakers took this idea further by suggesting his wife Courtney Love was behind it all –
see the El Duce interview in “Kurt & Courtney.”
[Interviewer]: You did some deal with Courtney, right?
[El Duce]: Yeah.
She offered me fifty grand to whack Kurt Cobain.
[Interviewer]: Yeah, I was telling this.
[Narrator]: However, most have concluded there isn’t enough evidence to support the murder claim.
As an incredible showman known for shocking theatrics, the “Prince of Darkness” was used to animal carcasses on stage.
After all, the “Godfather of heavy metal” bit off a dove’s head during a CBS Records meeting.
But his fans probably thought he was bat-shit crazy when he bit a bat’s head off.
And make no mistake: this was no rubber toy and no myth.
[Osbourne]: I thought it was one of those Halloween rubber things, and I just bit into it, and it was a real bat.
[Narrator]: After the bat bit back, Ozzy was tested for rabies.
Do you agree with our list? What do you think is the most shocking rock myth?
Be sure to subscribe to WatchMojo.com for more entertaining top tens.
